page.title: 10HELMINGTON HALL, HUNWICK
page.content: Helmington Hall is situated in fields for grazing cattle and sheep.It is very large and is built of stone blocks.Inside there is a lounge,a kitchen,six bedrooms and a children's nursery.There are three buildings around it for storing farm machinery.Just below the Hall are 2 orchards where apples grow.Helmington Hall now belongs to the Tinkler family but in the past it belonged to the Spenser family.Winston Spenser Churchill spent time there as a boy.The Hall is only a tiny fragment of a much larger building built over two hundred years ago.Beside the Hall is an arch called a Norman arch.Beneath it runs a small track.With its sash windows and cobbled yard Helmington Hall overlooks a small stream.
